name: Croqui do Label
description:
A 740ft waterfall. Soaking most of the way down on rappel. What more is there to say. This is a unique experience on a worldwide basis. Highly recommended to hire the local guide service as the multi-pitch 740 foot sequence has several hanging anchor stations, getting a rope stuck or core shot would be disastrous. Sequencing every pitch with the correct rope length must be done at the very top.

Approach

Hike 1 mile through light bush to the start of the drainage (-14.63056,-47.41960).

Descent

Entry sequence of short rappels is a nice warm up. This is followed by creek walking for 500m then 3km of trail on creek right. This brings you to an affinity pool and the big show-stopper, the 240m (740ft) falls, start with a 3m traverse line to a 70m rappel. Longest single pitch is 100m. BE SURE TO HAVE A 330 FOOT ROPE AND PLENTY OF EXTRA IN CASE OF ROPE STUCK. At bottom of 70m there is a 1m wide deck for up to 10 people with a safety line to clip into. Next is 100m rappel followed by a series of smaller rappels most of which have hanging anchors with minimal footing if any. BEST PRACTICE IS TO TIE J-TIES ON ALL BIG WALL RAPPELS so passengers do not rappel of the end of the rope.

Exit

Go for a swim. Dry off ropes and neoprene. Relax with the tourists. Hike 1.1 mile along the river trail to parking. Cold drinks available for purchase at the camp store.

Red tape

Exit is on private land. Pay parking fee when arriving and leaving the shuttle vehicle in the lot. Guides available but need to book in advance.
